name: 10.21 "Take Me Out of the Ball Game" Quiz | Television | 10 Questions

questions.text: Which comic strip was Woody reading?
questions.explanation:
Ziggy.

	Rebecca said that Woody would be useless for the next 15 minutes. Woody was laughing so hard he fell on the floor. "Ziggy" is a comic strip by Tom Wilson that started in 1968.

questions.text: How old was Lilith's great uncle turning?
questions.explanation:
98.

	Frasier didn't want to go to the party because the man would have no idea who he was anyway. Lilith agreed he didn't have to go.

questions.text: What was the name of Lilith's lab rat?
questions.explanation:
Whiskers.

	She had Frasier take care of Whiskers while she was gone. She said she named him Whiskers, because "his whiskers were so pronounced".

questions.text: What did Sam decide to do in this episode?
options: Become a tight end for the Patriots
questions.explanation:
Return to the Sox.

	His friend said the Sox were hurting for pitches so he was going to make a come back. After talking to Norm and Cliff, Sam decided he wanted to play baseball again as well.

Responsibility.

	Norm pointed out that she had 8 children. She responded, "Well I wouldn't have if I were responsible."

questions.text: What did Cliff say caused the Bubonic Plague?
questions.explanation:
The Bubon.

	He claimed that rats were falsely blamed for the plague. There is no such animal as a bubon.

questions.text: Where did Sam first go after getting back on the Red Sox minor league team?
questions.explanation:
Connecticut.

	He sent the gang a postcard. The other man, Mitch, ended up hurting his pitching arm when fell down the Cheers steps after tripping over a rat. The rat most likely was Whiskers who had gotten away.

questions.text: Who kept pressing levers trying to get peanuts?
questions.explanation:
Norm and Cliff.

	Cliff got a peanut on the first two tries. Norm however got a shock. Then they both kept getting shocked.

Monday.

	Sam's pitching name was Mayday, not Monday. Sam told Carla that Slim was his roommate.

questions.text: Did Sam like his return to baseball?
questions.explanation:
No.

	The other guys were younger than him and Sam didn't like how they acted. He said baseball was a kid's game and he was no longer a kid.
